title: Project Details
text: Insurance companies need to identify which customers are more likely to file a claim. However, claims are rare compared to non-claims, which creates a highly imbalanced dataset and makes prediction challenging.

title: Project Details
text: Insurance companies need to identify which customers are more likely to file a claim. However, claims are rare compared to non-claims, which creates a highly imbalanced dataset and makes prediction challenging.

title: Project Details
text:
Our Approach

Loaded, cleaned, and validated the dataset

Explored key patterns in demographics, vehicle features, and region

Identified class imbalance and addressed it using oversampling

Built a Random Forest classification model to predict claim likelihood

Evaluated performance using ROC-AUC, F1 score, accuracy, and confusion matrix

title: Project Details
text:
Key Insights

Claims are extremely rare, making imbalance a central issue

Several features (vehicle age, region density, safety features) show clear predictive strength

Oversampling allowed the model to learn meaningful claim patterns

The Random Forest model provided reliable performance on the test set

title: Project Details
text:
Team Members

Kenan Batu
Nyasha Sibanda

title: Insurance Claims Analysis
text:
This website summarizes our group project on predicting insurance claim likelihood using policyholder demographics, vehicle characteristics, and policy features.
Because claims are rare compared to non-claims, the original dataset is highly imbalanced. We clean the data, explore key patterns, address the class imbalance with oversampling, and train a machine learning model to estimate the probability that a customer will file a claim.

title: Insurance Claims Analysis
